questions.question_text: What is Newton's second law of motion?

options.a: An object at rest will remain at rest, and an object in motion will remain in motion unless acted upon by an external force.
options.c: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
options.d: Acceleration is inversely proportional to mass.

questions.question_text: What does the first law of thermodynamics state?

options.a: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.
options.c: The heat capacity of an object depends on its temperature.
options.d: Work done is equal to the change in internal energy.

options.a: The induced electromotive force in any closed circuit is equal to the negative of the rate of change of the magnetic flux through the circuit.
options.b: The force between two point charges is directly proportional to the product of the charges and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.
options.c: A moving charge creates a magnetic field perpendicular to the direction of motion.
options.d: The electric field due to a point charge decreases with distance according to an inverse square law.

questions.question_text: What is the formula for calculating velocity?
What is the unit of electric charge?
What is the SI unit of force?
What is the process of heat transfer through direct contact called?
What is the phenomenon where a material becomes magnetized in the presence of an external magnetic field and retains its magnetism when the field is removed?
What is the conservation of momentum?

options.a: Total momentum of a closed system remains constant if no external forces act on it.
options.b: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.
options.c: The entropy of an isolated system always increases.
options.d: The pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume.
